thread.title: Diddy Is Asking People To Rap Their Favorite Biggie Verse For The 20th Anniversary Of His Death
thread.title_full: Diddy Is Asking People To Rap Their Favorite Biggie Verse For The 20th Anniversary Of His Death

author: Sylvia Obell
title: Diddy Is Asking People To Rap Their Favorite Biggie Verse For The 20th Anniversary Of His Death
text:
View this image ›
Chris Walter / WireImage ID: 10672582 2. Biggie’s friend and collaborator, Diddy, is asking everyone to honor the late rapper’s legacy by rapping their favorite verse and posting it with the hashtag #WeMissYouBig. Loading View on Instagram
instagram.com Diddy said that he plans on editing all the best videos together to create something special to memorialize his friend.
ID: 10672625 3. A few famous rappers have already joined the challenge including Fabolous, who chose a verse from “Juicy.” IT WAS ALL A DREAM! S/O my brother @myfabolouslife! Rap your favorite Biggie verse, tag me and use the hashtag… https://t.co/lNRhLwloqZ
— Sean Diddy Combs (@diddy) ID: 10672638 4. Jermaine Dupri, who chose a verse from “Unbelievable.” #WeMissYouBIG @diddy @invisiblebully_
— Jermaine Dupri (@jermainedupri) ID: 10672667 5. And Belly, who also chose a verse from “Juicy.” My brother @reBELLYus doing it for B.I.G. like this! Post your favorite Biggie verse, tag me and use the hashtag… https://t.co/xw7CpGWah7
— Sean Diddy Combs (@diddy) ID: 10672661 6. And so have fans nationwide with verses from “Warning”… Loading View on Instagram
instagram.com ID: 10673333 7. “Juicy” Loading View on Instagram
instagram.com ID: 10673500 8. “Flavor in Ya Ear” Loading View on Instagram
Instagram: @reekspeaks ID: 10673524 9. “Notorious Thugs” Loading View on Instagram
Instagram: @ethathelegend ID: 10673533 10. And “Sky’s the Limit.” Loading View on Instagram
Instagram: @heirjordan1 ID: 10673537 11. On Instagram, Diddy also shared the memory of the first time he ever met Biggie: at the famous soul food restaurant, Sylvia’s in Harlem. Loading View on Instagram
instagram.com ID: 10672698 12. He said Biggie was quiet and didn’t want to eat anything. “That’s how important [getting a record deal] was to him,” Diddy explained. Loading View on Instagram
instagram.com ID: 10672760 13. The Bad Boy Entertainment CEO also revealed that his forthcoming documentary, Can’t Stop, Won’t Stop: The Bad Boy Story , will debut at the Tribeca Film Festival this spring. View this image ›
Ethan Miller / Getty Images The film will examine the label’s origins, its influence, and Biggie’s murder, while following Diddy as he tries to reunite the Bad Boy Family. “Tribeca brings the biggest names in entertainment and culture together with visionaries from across industries to celebrate the power of storytelling,” Diddy told Billboard in a statement. “There is no better place to share the story behind the Bad Boy movement and this unprecedented musical event.”
ID: 10672825 14. Diddy is really doing it big (sorry) for the 20th anniversary of Biggie’s death. But did you really expect any different? View this image ›
Bad Boy / Via giphy.com Rest in peace, B.I.G.
ID: 10672871
